metadata.Title: CVE-2022-43705 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Botan before 2.19.3, it is possible to forge OCSP responses due to a certificate verification error. This issue was introduced in Botan 1.11.34 (November 2016).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-43705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

botan - 2.19.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libbotan-2-19 - 2.19.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python3-botan - 2.19.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: botan package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.19.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
